{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"single-crystal transducer", "p":"uses", "o":"piezoelectric crystal", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"At the heart of the transducer is the piezoelectric crystal, the active element that generates and receives ultrasound waves."},
    {"s":"single-crystal transducer", "p":"uses", "o":"matching layer", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"On one side, there is a matching layer, which I mentioned earlier — it’s used to match the acoustic impedance of the crystal to that of the tissue."},
    {"s":"single-crystal transducer", "p":"uses", "o":"damping material", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"Behind the crystal, you’ll see a damping material. This is essential because it absorbs unwanted echoes and stops the crystal from ringing after each pulse."},

evidence: Behind the crystal, you’ll see a damping material. This is essential because it absorbs unwanted echoes and stops the crystal from ringing after each pulse.
